lead_paragraph: California's public-employee pension fund said today that it would invest up to $225 million to build homes as part of an effort to help the state's depressed housing market. Officials said it was the first time the California Public Employees Retirement System, the nation's largest public pension fund, with an investment portfolio of nearly $60 billion, had budgeted money to invest in residential real estate, a field that pension funds generally avoid.
